titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the George B. McClellan scrapbooks
1904-1909
MS 3187
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:16 -0400.

did.abstract: 90 volumes of scrapbooks containing mostly newspaper clippings, with some correspondence and other papers. Scrapbooks are regarding George B. McClellan, Jr.'s service as mayor of New York City, with some family-related materials also present. They are divided into several series, and labeled with series name and date on the spine of each volume.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: George Brinton McClellan (1865-1940) was the son of the Civil War general of the same name. McClellan served as President of New York City's Board of Aldermen and later for eight years in the U.S. Congress. He was Mayor of New York City from 1904-1909, which is the period that these scrapbooks are focused on. After leaving office, McClellan went on to his alma mater, Princeton University, where he lectured in public affairs and economic history.
(This note is based on Eleanor J. Conway's article about the collection in N-YHS's Quarterly Bulletin of October 1942.)
